I enjoy the mix of farming, crafting, merging, and exploring. I also like the fact that there are multiple ways for you to get more energy so there's no need to make a purchase if you don't want to. It does get a little slow once you reach a higher level, but I don't really mind waiting for my energy to replenish.

So far so great! Before you roll your eyes and scroll by, yes, this game is an isometric, camp/wild areas, randomly run into other players in wild areas, game. But it is SO MUCH MORE. If you've also been a fan of these style games but grown tired of all of them being exactly the same, this is the one that finally did it right. You can join a "family" of four players and your personal camps are placed directly next to each other and you can visit as you please. There are raids, events, etc.

To be honest, I don't know if I really like this game, or totally hate it. The gameplay mechanics are beautiful, some of which I am used from similar games like Westland Survival. Base building, exploring the map, crafting, fighting - even classes! really awesome! On the downside, the Co-op is not really thought out well. You should have an option to disable it, and not meet any players. It is VERY annoying when you get to a location, or an event, kill enemies, only for other players to steal the loot from under your nose!!!.... also, upgrading a single piece of wall or floor for 20 boards? seriously? to craft them takes 80 minutes as one board is 4 minutes... WAY too much... I like this game, but I cannot recommend it completely.

Even skipping a story scene gives you a brief summary before you move on. Carefully thought out, well done game. 5/5 all the way.

Really love the game so far. Nice graphics even on the lowest settings which can improve fps by a lot. Very short loading time is a huge plus for me. Although the upgrade options for the heroes and your team can be overwhelming. Too many options and too many resources for them. And PLEASE add more open time for Timed Challenges. The 1 hour window is really short especially when it's based on server time. I wasn't able to do them yet due the time zone restriction and I need them for the quests.

A pretty basic, yet fun gacha game overall. The character design is nice and the gameplay keeps me entertained for hours. My only gripes are that when I want to type something into a description box (example: guild motto or my personal card message) I keep getting notified that I'm using invalid or banned characters, even a simple punctuation mark is considered not allowed. Also, there's a bug where Cupid's platter does the cha-cha during cutscenes.

Gameplay is fine, story and characters are nice.. but these gacha games with low rates, and extremely low ways to obtain obtain currency should stop. Update: Used over 170 cards for the basic hero summon, got 4 new SR characters and the rest were duplicates. 0 SSR. Used 40 genesis cards and got 1 new SR and the rest were all duplicate, 0 SSR. Not playing a game with rates this low.. and yes events sure help when it's MOSTLY spending events.
It's good so far just started this evening

Diamond in the rough in every regard. A game with a unique 3d combat system featuring dozens of very well designed characters, with voice acting for all npc lines I've so far seen (expens.). The current launch has been quite generous to me in regards to incentives, and I've had a fun time playing so far. This isn't to say the game is without fault, some meshing issues on models, and rough graphics are immediately noticeable and are my only complaint; for a game still in pre-reg, much potential!

Way better than other home designer apps in that the animations are smooth and transitions fairly seamless. Would love to see some more of the Steam House Flipper options integrated here in future updates, like adding/removing walls and outside options. My main issue, and the reason this does not get 5 stars, is the REQUIRED use of premium currency to fulfil orders. I don't have an issue with using premium currency to unlock things to put in the houses we flip - that's a personal choice. However, to be forced to use my premium currency to complete a customer's order is ridiculous, especially since you don't earn any of it back when the order is completed. And the forced wait to earn the money after completing an order is also annoying - I'd be happy to watch an ad to speed things up, but it is an insult after you've spent time completing an order to then be forced to wait to receive the money you have earned. Far too many transactions that require premium currency, this needs to rebalanced.

The dev's needs to understand that when people say the autoplay is bad, they DONT mean auto combat (even though that's horrible too). Quests run themselves, your character moves themselves, and really, you dont have to do anything. A side note: Were you so put of ideas that one f your classes has to be an 8 year old with gigantic flintlocks?

The game has AUTO PLAY on everything, you can just leave it to play itself. There questing ends at level 59, which you reach in about 40-50 minutes of playing and after that the next level requires you o be level 60, but you can't reach it as you have done all your events for the day. Your last resort is to grind mobs that could take at least 9 hours to get the required XP to reach level 60. I don't know what happens in the game after that. There are zones that look like the old zones from the PC Forsaken World, but they require you to be level 100 in order to travel there. The game has almost zero gameplay or things to do aside from leaving AUTO PLAY to play the game for you and occasionally to collect rewards or enhance your gear. It feels more boring than playing FarmVille. The game is an absolute letdown.
